1) Note that I have not relied on "Devastating critical", therefore I have not taken the involved feats. The idea is to have a defensive stalwart who is the "Last man standing" on the battlefield, and criticals are useless against constructs and undeads. Am I wrong?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
A tad lowish AB, Aquarius.  I like GDL's Hearth Guard split much better except for some dubious feat selections.  The class split is much better.  CoT will always glean the best with 10 levels.   Take specific note to the even ability levels upon completion.  Odd numbers are "throw-aways".

Great Cleave in Epic?  You do realize that all the Cleave feats are worthless against bosses, right?  Cleave is fine but unless committed to DevCrit, the Great version is somewhat superfluous (your AB is just not high enough to hit anything but pedestrian creature ACs with full BAB) and limited to PvM.  Maybe if you boost that mundane AB up nearer 45 it would make more sense.  Yes, we realize a Bull pot and +5 weapon will result in a net AB of around 48... eventually.  In a balanced environment, you can figure on an increase in creature AC in parallel.

Your saves will be the only hope against spellspammers so boost them as high as possible with more CoT.  Specifically, high clerics will drain that lofty HP total down to near 0 in one successful cast.  Imploders will be equally dangerous.

edit: I found this one laying around and am guessing it was a version of GDL's wall I may have built for someone in the past (I don't play walls myself.)  Take note of the differences between Defensive Dwarf and this (I left space for Grt Cleave if you are intent on retaining it)...

AC (naked/mundane armor+shield only): 17/28

Skills: 172 - Discipline 43(52), Listen 43(42), Spellcraft 18(20), Tumble 20(21), remaining ---> 10




You'll want to max at least one detection skill against stealthers.  Spot is fine.  Listen is better.  And you should have enough skill ranks to reach a modified Spellcraft of 20 for an additional save vs. spells.  Again, strive to reach round numbers that have direct consequence in combat.

UMD(rog) vs. saves (CoT)?  That's always a tough decision and a realm-specific one as well.  UMD is so powerful but still limited by caster level of items which can usually be easily dispelled.  It really comes down to the environment.  Lots of dispelling?  Pass on UMD/rog unless it makes powerful gear available that would normally be restricted from use.  Occasional/moderate dispel threats?  UMD makes a lot of sense in that case if there are high-level scrolls available.  Many servers avoid making uber spell scrolls like Grtr Sanctuary and Time Stop available at stores or as random drops.   In any case, a rogue/DwD is a different build and probably better suited for a finessed weapon and Epic Dodge for the ultimate attack evasion.

edit @Empyre:  The Swordflight modules are very well done but they really didn't offer much combat challenge for me and I even played classes that had been discouraged by rogueknight (clerics, wizards, shifters, etc.).   They are a decent test for fledgling builds, however.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I have never played Swordflight, so I don't know if dwarven waraxes are available, but that would fit the theme of a Dwarf better than a bastard sword, but the damage is practically identical, so it is purely an esthetic choice, unless you know which one has better enchantments available.

I would take Cleave at level 3 because that extra attack is a big deal when you only have 1 attack. that would bump Expertise to level 9, and bump Improved Critical to level 19.

Take Great Strength instead of Great Cleave at level 33 to gain one more AB.

EDR III is great, but it is coming at the cost of lower AB, so dropping it in favor of more strength for more AB is something to consider.

While you can't take Weapon Specialization as CoT, you can take Epic Weapon Specialization as CoT, so if (and only if) you can start taking DD one level earlier, that is a way to get 2 more levels of CoT. Never mind, I just looked in NWNWiki, and both CoT and DD require BAB+7, so you can't take either until after 7 levels of Fighter.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
The saves are quite good.  Not godly like a CHA Pally/CoT would be, but pretty good nonetheless.  Your Fort is decent so needs no further enhancement. I would sooner choose a feat to bolster a weakness like Lightning Reflexes (Iron Will was already applied) rather than a universal boost.  Against DevCrit threats, SkF: Discipline would also deserve some consideration.  It comes down to what you consider the most dangerous and prolific opposition that will determine the nuances of your build choices (there is no such generic "one-size-fits-all" build design that addresses every weakness).

I understand completely about the Waraxe issue and have faced that myself and was forced, reluctantly, into using battle axe.  For that reason it's usually advisable to build a general "test" toon (like a high-level fighter who can focus/specialize in multiple weapons) whose main responsibility is to determine the range of equipment furnished within the environment before attempting to optimize a build around one particular weapon.  It's always been a problem even in PnP... believe it or not. You never know what the world will contain and what color the apples fall from the trees.  Sometimes servers will provide a re-leveler to make those sorts of benign adjustments or a sympathetic DM can help retool an otherwise solid build.  IMO a progressive environment always provides some means to accommodate personal bias and refrains from "funneling" weapon focus away from gear they believe must be further balanced.  (Too arbitrary for my tastes.)

Epic saves will cost you 1 AB/1 dmg/1 discipline because all the epic general feats are used for Great ability bumps and the ftr/CoT/DwD bonus feat lists do not include those sorts of feats.  IMO I would relinquish AB like I would allow someone to begin chopping off fingers in the hope that my luck would change in the future because of it.  But if you DO feel there is value, then succumb two general feats rather than one.  There are those odd numbers (ala STR 16(27)) haunting your steps again, eh?

From what I have understood the AB is the priority, so the improvement of the saving throws is not to pursue....I agree with that
It is important to take in consideration that for Saving throws against spells there is a +6 bonus, so the entire bonus to ST is minimum 30...

The only thing that comes in my mind is, if the server/module is full of undead, I can throw away the "Improved critical" feat, replacing it with "blind fight" or "knockdown" (for example): this will save a slot for "General feats", that can be occupied by "Lightning Reflexes" or "SkF:Discipline"...
